citation.fr: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"7ac2cc3e-acc1-42a1-89fe-249fe8a6999f\", \"author\": [{\"literal\": \"Ocean Networks Canada Society\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2024\", \"05\", \"08\"]}], \"abstract\": \"Ce Lufft WS501 (S/N 097.1219.1009.231) Weather Station a \u00e9t\u00e9 d\u00e9ploy\u00e9 le 2020-02-11 au Baynes Sound. Baynes Sound est situ\u00e9e entre Denman Island et l\u2019\u00cele de Vancouver. Cet instrument est un Station m\u00e9t\u00e9orologique. Les stations m\u00e9t\u00e9orologiques sont des appareils qui effectuent des mesures m\u00e9t\u00e9orologiques de routine de l'atmosph\u00e8re et sont compos\u00e9es d'une s\u00e9rie de capteurs. Des exemples typiques de ces mesures incluent la temp\u00e9rature, la pression barom\u00e9trique, l'humidit\u00e9, les pr\u00e9cipitations, le rayonnement solaire, la vitesse et la direction du vent. Il a \u00e9t\u00e9 deploy\u00e9 sur une plateforme fixe. Les donn\u00e9es de ce d\u00e9ploiement sont archiv\u00e9es et accessibles sur l\u2019infrastructure num\u00e9rique Oceans 3.0 du R\u00e9seau Canadien des Oc\u00e9ans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualit\u00e9 et produits d\u00e9riv\u00e9s selon les conventions \u00e9tablies.\", \"edition\": \"\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"\", \"title\": \"Baynes Sound Station m\u00e9t\u00e9orologique d\u00e9ploy\u00e9 2020-02-11\", \"language\": \"fr\", \"URL\": \"http://ckan.onc.uvic.ca/dataset/7ac2cc3e-acc1-42a1-89fe-249fe8a6999f?local=fr\"}]
citation.en: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"7ac2cc3e-acc1-42a1-89fe-249fe8a6999f\", \"author\": [{\"literal\": \"Ocean Networks Canada Society\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2024\", \"05\", \"08\"]}], \"abstract\": \"The Lufft WS501 (S/N 097.1219.1009.231) Weather Station was deployed on 2020-02-11 at Baynes Sound. Baynes Sound is located between Denman Island and Vancouver Island. This device is a Meteorological Station. Meteorological stations are instruments that make routine meteorological measurements on the atmosphere and are comprised of a suite of sensors. Typical examples of measurements include temperature, barometric pressure, humidity, rainfall, solar radiation, wind speed and direction. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.\", \"edition\": \"\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"\", \"title\": \"Baynes Sound Meteorological Station Deployed 2020-02-11\", \"language\": \"en\", \"URL\": \"http://ckan.onc.uvic.ca/dataset/7ac2cc3e-acc1-42a1-89fe-249fe8a6999f?local=en\"}]

      <mri:abstract xsi:type="lan:PT_FreeText_PropertyType">
        <gco:CharacterString>The Lufft WS501 (S/N 097.1219.1009.231) Weather Station was deployed on 2020-02-11 at Baynes Sound. Baynes Sound is located between Denman Island and Vancouver Island. This device is a Meteorological Station. Meteorological stations are instruments that make routine meteorological measurements on the atmosphere and are comprised of a suite of sensors. Typical examples of measurements include temperature, barometric pressure, humidity, rainfall, solar radiation, wind speed and direction. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.</gco:CharacterString>
        <lan:PT_FreeText>
          <lan:textGroup>
            <lan:LocalisedCharacterString locale="fra">Ce Lufft WS501 (S/N 097.1219.1009.231) Weather Station a été déployé le 2020-02-11 au Baynes Sound. Baynes Sound est située entre Denman Island et l’Île de Vancouver. Cet instrument est un Station météorologique. Les stations météorologiques sont des appareils qui effectuent des mesures météorologiques de routine de l'atmosphère et sont composées d'une série de capteurs. Des exemples typiques de ces mesures incluent la température, la pression barométrique, l'humidité, les précipitations, le rayonnement solaire, la vitesse et la direction du vent. Il a été deployé sur une plateforme fixe. Les données de ce déploiement sont archivées et accessibles sur l’infrastructure numérique Oceans 3.0 du Réseau Canadien des Océans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualité et produits dérivés selon les conventions établies.</lan:LocalisedCharacterString>
          </lan:textGroup>
        </lan:PT_FreeText>
      </mri:abstract>

          <mac:type>
            <gco:CharacterString>Lufft WS501-UMB weather station</gco:CharacterString>
          </mac:type>
          <mac:description>
            <gco:CharacterString>An all-in-one, multi-sensor weather station that uses Universal Measurement Bus communication protocol. Designed for observing weather above water in multiple applications (e.g. road and traffic control systems, hydro-meteorological stations and weather stations at airports, marinas and onboard ships). Measures air temperature, relative humidity, air pressure, wind direction, wind speed and radiation. An additional temperature or rain sensor can be externally connected. Relative humidity is measured by means of a capacitive sensor element; a precision NTC measuring element is used to measure air temperature; an integrated Kipp and Zonen CMP3 pyranometer measures solar radiation; ultrasonic sensor technology is used to take wind measurements; and air pressure is measured by means of a MEMS capacitive sensor. It consists of an integrated heater (to protect against frost) and aspirated radiation shield. There are no moving parts yielding maintenance free operation. Configuration and polling of the device takes place in binary protocol. As the system operates without collision detection, the master-slave principle is strictly observed. In order to simplify communication, especially for polling measurement values, it is possible to switch over to ASCII protocol. The accuracy is +/-0.2 to +/-0.5 degrees celsius for air temperature, +/-2% RH for humidity, +/-0.7 degrees celsius for dewpoint temperature, +/- 1.5hPa for air pressure, +/-0.3 m/s or +/-3% to +/-5% RMS for wind speed, <3 degrees for wind direction, and 2% for precipitation.</gco:CharacterString>
          </mac:description>
        </mac:MI_Instrument>
      </mac:instrument>
    </mac:MI_AcquisitionInformation>

name: 7ac2cc3e-acc1-42a1-89fe-249fe8a6999f
notes: The Lufft WS501 (S/N 097.1219.1009.231) Weather Station was deployed on 2020-02-11 at Baynes Sound. Baynes Sound is located between Denman Island and Vancouver Island. This device is a Meteorological Station. Meteorological stations are instruments that make routine meteorological measurements on the atmosphere and are comprised of a suite of sensors. Typical examples of measurements include temperature, barometric pressure, humidity, rainfall, solar radiation, wind speed and direction. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.

notes_translated.en: The Lufft WS501 (S/N 097.1219.1009.231) Weather Station was deployed on 2020-02-11 at Baynes Sound. Baynes Sound is located between Denman Island and Vancouver Island. This device is a Meteorological Station. Meteorological stations are instruments that make routine meteorological measurements on the atmosphere and are comprised of a suite of sensors. Typical examples of measurements include temperature, barometric pressure, humidity, rainfall, solar radiation, wind speed and direction. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.
notes_translated.fr: Ce Lufft WS501 (S/N 097.1219.1009.231) Weather Station a été déployé le 2020-02-11 au Baynes Sound. Baynes Sound est située entre Denman Island et l’Île de Vancouver. Cet instrument est un Station météorologique. Les stations météorologiques sont des appareils qui effectuent des mesures météorologiques de routine de l'atmosphère et sont composées d'une série de capteurs. Des exemples typiques de ces mesures incluent la température, la pression barométrique, l'humidité, les précipitations, le rayonnement solaire, la vitesse et la direction du vent. Il a été deployé sur une plateforme fixe. Les données de ce déploiement sont archivées et accessibles sur l’infrastructure numérique Oceans 3.0 du Réseau Canadien des Océans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualité et produits dérivés selon les conventions établies.

description_translated.en: The Canadian Integrated Ocean Observing System (CIOOS) Pacific is the regional hub of the National CIOOS for ocean data aggregation on Canada’s west coast.
description_translated.fr: Le Système intégré d’observation des océans canadien (SIOOC) Pacifique est la plaque tournante régionale du SIOOC national pour l’agrégation des données océaniques sur la côte ouest du Canada.

title: Baynes Sound Meteorological Station Deployed 2020-02-11
